thread.title: Obama to launch non-profit inner-city youth initiative
thread.title_full: Obama to launch non-profit inner-city youth initiative

title: Obama to launch non-profit inner-city youth initiative
text: Obama: Violence in Baltimore is 'counterproductive' 03:25 Washington (CNN) As unrest in Baltimore again focuses attention on race relations in America, President Barack Obama plans to re-launch his My Brother's Keeper Initiative -- meant to address the opportunity deficit for minority youth -- as a non-profit organization. He'll travel to the Bronx on Monday to unveil the "My Brother's Keeper Alliance" at Lehman College, part of the City University of New York System. A job listing found online describes the organization as "in a startup phase" and "preparing for hyper-growth." Obama first announced the My Brother's Keeper program in 2014 as an attempt to reverse trends showing young men of color are more likely to drop out of school, get in trouble with the lawor be unemployed. RELATED: Obama 'devastated' after viewing shooting video He's held events at the White House and in Washington over the past year highlighting the program's efforts, including new mentoring programs and partnerships with professional athletes, and he's expected to continue his focus on those issues after he leaves the White House in 2017. Speaking about the plight of young black men and boys, Obama has often evoked his own childhood with an absent father. But he's noted that the opportunities presented to him, like quality schooling, should be available for all American children. He noted during a press conference on Tuesday that crime rates in neighborhoods of Baltimore and elsewhere are directly linked to a lack of opportunity. "In communities where there are no fathers who can provide guidance to young men; communities where there's no investment, and manufacturing has been stripped away; and drugs have flooded the community, and the drug industry ends up being the primary employer for a whole lot of folks -- in those environments, if we think that we're just going to send the police to do the dirty work ... then we're not going to solve this problem," he said. Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos President Barack Obama attends the 2014 Nuclear Security Summit in March 2014 in the Hague, Netherlands. As his presidency winds down, here's a look at some key moments of his administration. Hide Caption 1 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Michelle Obama brushes specks from the coat of then-Sen. Obama inside the Old State Capitol in Springfield, Illinois, just before he announced his candidacy for president of the United States in February 2007. Their daughters Malia, left, and Sasha wait in the foreground. Hide Caption 2 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama appears on "Meet the Press" with Tim Russert, right, in Des Moines, Iowa, in November 2007. Hide Caption 3 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama shakes hands with supporters after addressing a rally in Concord, New Hampshire, in January 2008. Hide Caption Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama gives a speech at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia in March 2008. Hide Caption Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama speaks at the 2008 Democratic National Convention in Denver, Colorado. Hide Caption 6 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama stands on stage in Chicago, Illinois, with his family after defeating Republican presidential candidate John McCain on November 4, 2008. Hide Caption 7 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Left to right: Presidents George H. W. Bush, Obama, George W. Bush, Bill Clinton, and Jimmy Carter pose for photos in the Oval Office in January 2009. Hide Caption 8 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama is sworn in by Chief Justice John Roberts as the 44th President of the United States on the West Front of the Capitol in Washington on January 20, 2009. Hide Caption 9 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos As retired military officers stand behind him, Obama signs an executive order to close down the detention center at Guantanamo Bay in January 2009. Hide Caption 10 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama and Vice President Joe Biden look at solar panels as they tour the solar array at the Denver Museum of Nature and Science on February 17, 2009. That same day, Obama signed the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act. Hide Caption 11 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos A soldier hugs Obama during his surprise visit to Camp Victory just outside Baghdad, Iraq, in April 2009. Hide Caption 12 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama bends over so the son of a White House staff member can pat his head during a visit to the Oval Office in May 2009. The boy wanted to know if Obama's hair felt like his. Hide Caption 13 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama kisses Sonia Sotomayor's cheek after announcing her as his nominee for justice on the Supreme Court in May 2009. Hide Caption 14 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Palestinian security forces in Jenin, West Bank, listen to Obama speak from Cairo University in Egypt in June 2009. The Palestinian Authority hailed as a "good beginning" Obama's speech to the Muslim world in which he reiterated his support for a Palestinian state. Hide Caption 15 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama and first lady Michelle Obama meet with Pope Benedict XVI in Vatican City in July 2009. Hide Caption 16 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama hosts the Apollo 11 astronauts, from left to right, Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin, Michael Collins and Neil Armstrong in the Oval Office on July 20, 2009, the 40th anniversary of the moon landing. Hide Caption 17 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Police Sgt. James Crowley, second right, of Cambridge, Massachusetts, speaks with Harvard Professor Henry Louis Gates Jr., second left, alongside Obama and Biden as they share beers on the South Lawn of the White House in July 2009. In an effort to curb controversy, the so-called "Beer Summit," was held after Crowley arrested Gates at his own home which sparked tensions and racial furor. Hide Caption 18 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama salutes during the transfer of Sgt. Dale R. Griffin at Dover Air Force Base in Dover, Delaware, in October 2009. Obama traveled to the base to meet the plane carrying the bodies of 18 U.S. personnel killed in Afghanistan on October 26, including Griffin. Hide Caption Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama walks along the Great Wall of China in November 2009. Hide Caption 20 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama delivers a speech after receiving the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, Norway, in December 2009. Hide Caption 21 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Presidents Obama, Clinton, and Bush walk to the Rose Garden to speak about relief efforts for earthquake-stricken Haiti in January 2010. Hide Caption 22 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos First daughters Sasha and Malia Obama play in the snow with their father in the Rose Garden during a snowstorm that hit Washington in February 2010. Hide Caption 23 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama's signature on the Affordable Healthcare Act is seen at the White House in March 2010. Hide Caption 24 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama throws out the opening pitch before a baseball game between the Philadelphia Phillies and the Washington Nationals on Opening Day at Nationals Park in Washington in April 2010. Hide Caption 25 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama and daughter, Sasha, swim at Alligator Point in Panama City Beach, Florida, in August 2010, in an effort to encourage people to come back to the Gulf Coast after the devastating oil spill. Hide Caption 26 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama laughs as he makes a statement on his birth certificate in April 2011. Obama said he was amused over conspiracy theories about his birthplace, and said the media's obsession with the "sideshow" issue was a distraction in a "serious time." Hide Caption 27 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama, Biden, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and members of the national security team receive live updates in the Situation Room of the White House on the mission to capture or kill Osama bin Laden on May 1, 2011. Hide Caption 28 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos U.S. Marines of Regiment Combat Team 1 watch from Camp Dwyer in Afghanistan as Obama announces the death of Osama bin Laden on May 2, 2011. Hide Caption 29 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama enjoys a pint of Guinness in his ancestral home of Moneygall, Ireland, in May 2011. Hide Caption 30 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama, left, and first lady Michelle Obama, right, meet with Prince William, Duke of Cambridge and Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge, at Buckingham Palace in London in May 2011. Hide Caption 31 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama and Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon walk together in May 2011 during a tour of the devastation of Joplin, Missouri, after it was hit by tornado with winds over 200 mph. Hide Caption 32 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama delivers remarks to troops and military families at Fort Bragg, North Carolina, on December 14, 2011, marking the exit of U.S. soldiers from Iraq. Hide Caption 33 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama pays for a dog toy as he shops with his dog Bo at a Petsmart in Alexandria, Virginia, in December 2011. Hide Caption 34 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama sits on the famed Rosa Parks bus at the Henry Ford Museum in Dearborn, Michigan, in April 2012. Hide Caption 35 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos British Prime Minister David Cameron, Obama, German Chancellor Angela Merkel, and others watch the overtime shootout of the Champions League final soccer match between Chelsea and Bayern Munich in the Laurel Cabin conference room at Camp David, Maryland, during a G8 Summit in May 2012. Hide Caption 36 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama sits in his chair during a Cabinet meeting in the Cabinet Room in July 2012. This image was tweeted by his official Twitter account in August 2012 in response to Clint Eastwood's "empty chair" speech at the Republican National Convention. The tweet simply said, "This seat's taken." Hide Caption 37 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama casts a shadow in this picture as he accepts the 2012 Democratic nomination for president during the final day of the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, North Carolina, in September 2012. Hide Caption 38 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney and Obama participate in the first presidential debate of the 2012 election in Denver, Colorado, in October 2012. Hide Caption Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama celebrates on stage in Chicago after defeating Romney on Election Day November 6, 2012. Hide Caption 40 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama pauses during his speech at a memorial service in Newtown, Connecticut, for the victims and relatives of the Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre in December 2012. Hide Caption 41 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Hundreds of thousands gather at the U.S. Capitol building as Obama is inaugurated for his second term on January 21, 2013. Hide Caption 42 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Israeli President Shimon Peres, left, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, right, stand with Obama during an arrival ceremony for Obama at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv, Israel, in March 2013. Hide Caption 43 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama adjusts an umbrella held by a Marine during a news conference with Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan in the Rose Garden of the White House in May 2013. Hide Caption Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Jay Leno interviews Obama on "The Tonight Show" in August 2013. Hide Caption 45 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos White House press secretary Jay Carney fields questions from reporters during a daily press briefing at the White House in September 2013 after Obama's push for Congressional approval for limited military strikes against the Syrian government. Hide Caption 46 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Actor and comedian Zach Galifianakis interviews Obama during his appearance on "Between Two Ferns," a digital video series with a laser focus on reaching people aged 18 to 34. The President urged young people to sign up for the new health care plan in the video posted on the website Funny or Die. Hide Caption 47 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama walks to the Oval Office on August 7, 2014, the same day he announced the beginning of air strikes on ISIS. Hide Caption 48 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Obama speaks to the nation from the Cabinet Room of the White House about normalizing diplomatic relations with Cuba in December 2014. Hide Caption 49 of 50 Barack Obama's presidency 50 photos Left to right: House Majority Leader Rep. Kevin McCarthy, House Minority Leader Rep. Nancy Pelosi, and Speaker of the House Rep. John Boehner listen as Obama speaks during a meeting in the Cabinet Room of the White House on January 13, 2015. Hide Caption
